etymologies: late 16th century; earliest use found in John Harington (bap. 1560, d. 1612), courtier and author. From classical Latin pontificius of or relating to a pontifex + -al

definitions: Of, relating to, or belonging to a high-ranking cleric, especially the Pope.
Stately; lordly, imperious; depreciative haughty, arrogant, pompous.
